newsitem.title: CHINA: China to establish 60 mln tonne coal mine.
newsitem.headline: China to establish 60 mln tonne coal mine.

text.p: China is to spend 88.9 billion yuan ($10.7 billion) on developing its biggest coal mine to raise its annual production to 60 million tonnes, the Xinhua news agency said.

The Shenfu-Dongsheng coal mine, with annual coal production of 10 million tonnes, will raise that figure to 25 million tonnes by 2000 and to 60 million tonnes by 2010, the agency said in an overnight report.

A major aim of the investment is to boost infrastructure, particularly a railway, from the mine on the borders of northern Shaanxi province and the Inner Mongolia region, it said. It has proven reserves of 223.6 billion tonnes, or one-third of China's total.
More than 11 billion yuan has been invested in the project since 1986, with eight pits already dug, including one that produces three million tonnes of coal a year.
